DataElement.preferredName: Stoma Quality of Life Discharge Confidence Assessment Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the scale to evaluate a person's confidence to care for his/her stoma following discharge from a medical facility as part of the subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life following a surgical procedure that created an opening from an area inside the body to the outside.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Stoma Quality of Life Discharge Confidence Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the evaluation of a person's confidence to care for his/her stoma following discharge from a medical facility as part of the subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life following a surgical procedure that created an opening from an area inside the body to the outside.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (STO-ma) A surgically created opening from an area inside the body to the outside.:The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life.  The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness.

Concepts.definition: A surgically created opening from an area inside the body to the outside.

The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life. The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness.

Property.preferredDefinition: In healthcare, discharge represents the end point of an inpatient hospital contact which consists of one or several days of care. (from Wikipedia):A feeling of trust (in someone or something).:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The release of a patient from a course of care.
A feeling of trust (in someone or something).
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: information on quality of patient life and ability to function

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A number or range of numeric values measuring quality of life performance, function, quality, or ability.
